alert.note: Alert for Eastern Albany; Eastern Columbia; Eastern Dutchess; Eastern Greene; Eastern Schenectady; Eastern Ulster; Schoharie; Southern Saratoga; Western Albany; Western Columbia; Western Dutchess; Western Greene; Western Schenectady; Western Ulster (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albany (Eastern New York and Western New England)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 29 at 10:48PM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...SNOW SHOWERS WITH EMBEDDED SNOW SQUALLS WILL AFFECT PORTIONS OF SCHENECTADY...SOUTHERN SARATOGA...ALBANY...RENSSELAER...SCHOHARIE... COLUMBIA...GREENE...ULSTER...DUTCHESS AND BERKSHIRE COUNTIES... HAZARDS...A band of snow showers with embedded snow squalls accompanied by winds of up to 45 MPH, which can rapidly reduce visibility to less than a quarter of a mile. Precipitation will begin as rain in lower elevations before quickly changing to snow. LOCATION AND MOVEMENT...At 1046 PM EDT, snow showers with embedded snow squalls were located along a line extending from near Pownal to Hudson to Ellenville and moving east at 30 MPH. THESE SNOW SHOWERS AND SQUALLS WILL BE NEAR... Williamstown around 1050 PM EDT. North Adams, Claverack, Livingston and Claverack-Red Mills around 1055 PM EDT. Philmont around 1105 PM EDT. New Paltz, Wallkill, Florida and Modena around 1110 PM EDT. Monroe and Plattekill around 1115 PM EDT. Copake, Highland and Rowe around 1120 PM EDT. Poughkeepsie, Beacon, Marlboro and Fairview around 1130 PM EDT. Great Barrington, Wappingers Falls, Red Oaks Mill and Housatonic around 1135 PM EDT. This includes the following highways... Interstate 88 between exits 24 and 25. Interstate 90 between exits 10 and 26. Interstate 890 between exits 1a and 9. Interstate 87 between exits 18 and 7, and near exit 8A. Interstate 787 between exits 1 and 9. SAFETY INFO... Use extra caution if you must travel into or through these snow showers and snow squalls. Rapid changes in visibility and potentially slick roads may lead to accidents. &&
